Ok, I finally made it to play Airborne! BUT I used the HARTRED iso file that everybody said it was a fake - NOT! It is almost the standard Alcohol 120% or Daemon procedure! If you are having problem with this Dopeman version (wich I did) and still don´t want to quit on this absolutely stunning and way way better medal of honor (running on a P4, AGP platform - ATI X1950), do this (I´ll try to be very specific):

- make sure to have Alcohol120% (wich I used)or Daemon!
- download both HARTRED game and crack/keygen
- right click one of those rar files and drag it to Desktop, or another location, so that you´ll get a complete ISO file.
- open ISO file in Alcohol/Daemon and Mount it on drive (right click, choose mount on drive option)
- the install window will popup automatically, PRESS QUIT (I got a Fatal Error Blue Screen by pressing INSTALL)
- right click on the mounted drive and choose "Explore"
- run EASetup
- when asked for key, dont cancel the installation. Leave that window opened and go for the downloaded keygen. This file will generate a key and automatically place it in the key window left behind.
- continue with installation
- after all is complete, copy the downloaded crack file, find the "Binaries" folder in the game location (that´ll be by default: c:programfiles/EAGAMES/...) and paste the crack!

There you go.... game is ready to rumble! Someone said the game was crappy ´n sh..t. Pah, pathetic... He probably didn´t have enough hardware to see how it ROCKS! Graphics are awsome, movement and interaction are great, challenging enough without making you go frustrated! Medic packs can be found regularly (still you´ll have to look for them, making you explore all map); hidden weapons, stats and medals awarded, upgrades to your weapon (more accuracy, rate of fire, etc..)! It is the best Medal by very very far! :D

Sorry for the long post... I just had to do it!

Oh, btw, there is a "hartred" file inside the crack folder wich Iused it for nothing... Don´t touch it :):P I did it and also got Fatal Error Blue screen! Don´t know why, maybe it´s just my PC but... better safe! :P Still, if you tried and had no problem tell what it is all about!

Be Well :)

Getting too hot? Try opening the window (its below 60F here at night) or turning on the A/C, removing the side panel of your pc and putting a box fan to blow inside. I'm not joking. I was having trouble with cpu temps when converting video files (A64 X2 4000+ W/factory fan). All I did was remove the side panel and place a 27" box fan to blow inside. Now its running 125F.
That should be under 100 F (38 C)now instead of over 125 F (52 C) as it was running at times before.

QUESTION
What are the minimum requirements for Medal of Honor Airborne for PC?
Answer

OS: Microsoft Windows XP or Windows Vista (32-bit) 
Note: Windows XP Service Pack 2 is required to play the game 
CPU: 2.8 GHz or faster (3.0 GHz or faster for Windows Vista) 
RAM: 1 GB or more 
Disc Drive: 8x or faster DVD-ROM drive 
Hard Drive: 9.0 GB or more free space 
Video: DirectX 9.0c-compatible video card with 128 MB or more memory, Pixel Shader 3.0 support, and one of these chipsets is required: 
ATI Radeon X1300 Pro or greater 
NVIDIA GeForce 6600 GT or greater 
Note: NVIDIA 6800XT/LE, 7100GS, 7200GS/LE, 7300 GS/GT are not supported 
Note: NVIDIA SLI and ATI Crossfire modes are NOT supported, and may have a negative effect on gameplay. In addition, if you have an NVIDIA SLI or ATI Crossfire setup, we recommend you do not use the 'Force Split Frame Rendering' option. This option has been shown to have a negative effect on performance. 
Sound: DirectX 9.0c-compatible sound card 
Input: Keyboard and mouse 
Multiplayer: 2-12 players, requires one disc per PC and a Cable, DSL, or faster connection. 
Note: The game uses UDP port 10000
